page.title: 15Lighthouses And Lightships
page.content: In 1669 Sir John Clayton sought permission to build a lighthouse at Corton and the light, a coal burning beacon atop what was described as the most curious lighthouse in Christendom, was first kindled on 22nd. September 1675.Mainly because of opposition from Trinity House, Clayton could not make his lighthouse pay and it was extinguished in 1679.Between 1864 and 1871 two wooden lighthouses stood on Corton cliffs towards Hopton to guide ships through the sandbanks.A lightship was first stationed four miles offshore in 1863;it was replaced by an automatic navigation buoy in 1968.
